timeline.message:
HIVE-23699: Cleanup HIVEQUERYRESULTFILEFORMAT handling

Change-Id: I8ce7061fde58fc94ee4750142f699e3cc23980fd

timeline.bodyText: Should I even bother with this interface? The intent was originally to have static definitions of getValidSet and getInvalid as part of the interface in addition to from. Except Java interfaces don't allow implementations of an interface to override static methods. The from method here is also not super useful in that I think I still have to fully qualify the call (I.E. HiveConfEnum.from()). It would be nice if we could define required static methods on a enum interface for future uses of enums in HiveConf, but I don't think it is cleanly possible.
timeline.author: jfsii

replies.bodyText: I am not sure we need the interface indeed, probably the utility method would suffice?
replies.author: jcamachor

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I'll remove it. I don't even remember why it was a question for me.
replies.author: jfsii
